website_summaries.verdict: An economical stroller that acts like a cradle to provide a perfect fit for various car seats.
pros: Boasts a large frame that accepts two infant car seats
One-hand fold makes it simple to transport the stroller between locations
Two-cupholder tray ensures you can take drinks and snacks on the go
Features rear wheels with brakes for extra stability
cons: Straps can be tough to snap together
Lower seat does not always sit level on the stroller

customer_reviews.title: Britax B safe compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Yes it works with the britax b safe. You have to remove these adapters off the car seat for it to sit inside the stroller. I only need the adapters if I plan to attach the car seat to my BOB running stroller. They are not necessary for the car seat to snap into the base that's used for the car.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Great Value & Fits Chicco KeyFit 30
customer_reviews.text: Very nice light and affordable stroller for infant car seats. Fits a Chicco KeyFit 30 perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Darthdude

customer_reviews.title: Awesome find!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a nuna car seat & the stroller system that goes with it is very expensive. SOO glad I came across this! It's super easy to put together, took me 5 mins. My nuna infant car seat fits perfect. It rolls smooth. So happy I found this!
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire Harm

customer_reviews.title: very convenient!
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the bad reviews detour you from buying this! I was a little sceptical myself but bought it anyways and I'm so glad I did. For the people saying they have a fear of the car seat tipping over or will slip out after hitting a bump, don't have the seat strapped in right. This is super convenient and I love it
customer_reviews.author: little bur

customer_reviews.title: Look no Further....
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this stroller. SO EASY to just drop in the baby seat, click a strap, and GO! Much lighter weight than most strollers and so much easier to put the baby seat in. I would never buy a stroller/baby seat combo again. One easy click (with ONE hand) and it folds up to go back in the car. PERFECT for little trips to the mall, school, etc. Probably not the best choice for someone who is planning on taking it out for a marathon on some mountain hills or something (but who does that?) Seriously, this is all you need. And this ain't my first rodeo - this is my fourth child!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Payne

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: Can't wait to take my LO out for a stroll. Price is incredible, assembly wasn't horrible probably 25 minutes max! Wheels turn effortlessly for easy movement and the stroller is lightweight. The only downfall is that you literally have to fasten a seat belt across your car seat and pull another strap below it to secure it in place. It does not snap like into place the same as attaching it to the car base. Please see photo for clarification. Aside from that one downfall it is a GREAT product very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product But Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. It is an inexpensive alternative to purchasing a full stroller. Our Chicco and Maxi Cosi fit perfectly. I was a little mislead by the name "Snap N Go" thinking it would click in like a carseat to it's base, which it does not. There is a strap that holds it in place. I really like it and it is perfect for what we use it for. I just take it on our walks around the subdivision but it can not handle the smallest of bumps in the sidewalk and I feel it would tip easily in any other situation.
customer_reviews.author: Dallis Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Scam!
customer_reviews.text: Rarely so irritated with a thing. It's not an expensive discounted carrier, it's something I would not pay 10$ for. As a proof, look for a same brand carrier for twins. It costs 65$ here on Amazon (still does not worth it). Looks bad and my seats are loose on it, looks like it's not good for any seat at all. Tried to return already, but once assembled it can not be disassembled (wheels are not designed to come off). Called Amazon and all they could offer is to look for a bigger box to accomplish the return as it does not fit the original box as is. Headache of a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Glaucon

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP STROLLER THAT FALLS APART
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this stroller.... DO NOT BUY THIS. Splurge $100+ for a Graco Click Connect instead!!! I ordered this and received on a Wednesday, used Friday and today (Saturday) and the front wheel broke off completely!!! So frustrating and useless, I ended up having to carry my baby’s car seat throughout the day thanks to this cheap excuse for a stroller! I thought it was too good to be true, this is 1/2 the price of the Graco Click connect, should have known better and just purchased the pricier original one instead...extremely unsatisfied with this purchase and now have to go through the hassle of a return.....
customer_reviews.author: natledesma

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a price of crap. It you get what you pay for. It’s a stroller for babies. Meaning you need to MOVE and NAVIGATE around objects like trees and corners in hallways, the wheels are the most frustrating things as they do not turn easily and frequent get stuck in the wrong position so you can’t even move forward. Next it’s for BABIES who like to be rocked. So standing still and pushing the stroller back and forth is a common thing to do with a baby. This is IMPOSSIBLE to do without great frustration with these wheels. How hard is it to design wheels that turn? Well done baby trend
customer_reviews.author: J.S.H

customer_reviews.title: I have the Uppababy Mesa and it works fine. However
customer_reviews.text: This snap and go stroller is adequate for running in and out somewhere so I don’t have to lug the car seat. I have the Uppababy Mesa and it works fine. However, I did have the Chicco snap and go with my first and that stroller maneuvered much easier. The wheels on this one just don’t rotate easily so it’s a pain to walk around with it more than just to a quick errand. I wouldn’t buy again, but if you are on a budget and have a good stroller like I do for usual outings this will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana K.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and useful
customer_reviews.text: I love this little caddy. Much lighter than a stroller, which means I can lift it and push it around right after giving birth. It would have been really difficult to get my little one to his 3 day checkup without this. Lots of storage space underneath, and rolls like any other full suze stroller. Its really nice not to have to get my newborn out of his carseat for every trip, especially in the colder months. In my opinion this is a must have for moms, and the price cant be beat.
customer_reviews.author: JB550

customer_reviews.title: Works with Nuna Pipa!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen some comments that it doesn’t work with a Nuna Pipa, but I think it’s perfect! Straps feed through the lap belt guides and tighten the strap. Car seat feels secure, and it’s an inexpensive and lightweight option!
customer_reviews.author: ciaobella

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this stroller for twins
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this stroller for twins! I used this for the first year after my twins were born. We were able take it everywhere. It folds down nicely and is not too heavy. It fits through doorways easily with no problem. I loved that I could leave my babies in their car seats and place them right in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than the Baby Trend stroller. Very light weight, so easy to get in/out of trunk- very little extra effort. Carrier sits a little more flat than I’d like in the straps- especially since I have a baby trends carrier I was expecting a better fit. It literally just sits on the straps- does not snap in at all. It’s secured by the cross snaps. Not my favorite aspect but easier than the stroller- which does allow a secure snap- in - that I used with my first baby. Easy to maneuver- even with one hand is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Neurotic Baby Momma

customer_reviews.title: All you need with a bucket seat!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this frame to use when we travel and it is so ideal that we now use it all the time. It folds up easily and fits in the trunks of both our Honda Civic and Nissan Altima. It's lightweight, which is nice, because we are bending down into sedan trunks, not loading horizontally into an SUV. The basket is plenty large for shopping bags and a diaper bag, and the cup holders hold even our 32 ounce yetis. Do not get sucked into purchasing a whole travel system with your bucket seat! This is all you need!
customer_reviews.author: SPT

customer_reviews.title: Both front wheels fell off in less than two months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April. After about a month and a half, the front right wheel fell off. I tried to put it back but it never securely stayed in place. Just when I felt I was able to fix it myself, the front left also came off. In less then two months of light using---we have another stroller that we use more often---on pavement, both front wheels broke and the whole thing is unusable. I understand that this is not a premium product at a premium price, yet it is still unacceptable for a something brand new to break so easily. I wish I still had time for return or exchange!
customer_reviews.author: Kaya

customer_reviews.title: Not a Very Durable Stroller
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this stroller is nice, but it wasn’t very durable. I’ve used this stroller twice, once outside, and once in a hospital and the tires are completely worn. It took nothing to get a whole in the mesh basket from snagging on something and the rubber handle cover has a small tear already. We purchased this for our Graco car seat after reading that it was compatible with most car seats including ours. However, this stroller was not very compatible. Our seat doesn’t sit snuggly on this stroller and wiggles quite a bit even with the buckle tightened. I love how compact it is, but I personally would not waste my money on this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Safety Hazzard-read 1star reviews!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was great for the price! You get what you pay for!!!! The front double wheel fell completely apart, luckily we caught it before a disaster happened. The wheels come fully assembled and you just attach them to the stroller! It’s a manufacturing issue. I called the company & they were going to send me a new wheel. I told them I’d be returning it bc I don’t trust that it won’t happen again but I wanted them to make note that it’s defective. Read the one star reviews it happens a lot!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JWW

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my third baby this past August because I remembered having it for my second, 3 years prior, and it was a lifesaver. While it still remains lightweight and easy to maneuver, the quality just seems to have gone down substantially from what I remember. It almost feels flimsy. I've put many strollers together in my time, and I know we assembled it properly but it seems like the wheels bend inward and get flat with a 3 month old in his car seat in it. My kid isn't huge either so Im not sure why that is. I was left a little disappointed but we do still use it for quick uses.
customer_reviews.author: tarabytes

customer_reviews.title: The car seat fits just fine. There is no locking mechanism on the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a Very pleasant surprise! We bought this to try and avoid spending $1300 on the common NYC stroller. The car seat fits just fine. There is no locking mechanism on the bottom but instead a strap that goes over the top of the car seat and clips. Seems a little old-school but it works great. I also don't feel comfortable running with it, but then, it's not supposed to be a running stroller. I wouldn't pay any more than $80-100 for it, but at that price, it's a Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: A must purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have had. After we gave away the one we used for our first when we moved, we purchased a new one when we got pregnant with our second. To me it's one of the most important baby products to have because it's so lightweight and easy to set baby in, and then throw in the back of the car when you're done. We completely stopped using our travel system carseat for our infant after we got this. Sometimes it can be hard to collapse all the way. I think it has something to do with the wheels, but I haven't really looked into it. I'm sure it's user error though.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewerMD

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work w/ a Graco Snugride Click Connect 35 carseat!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product does NOT work with a Graco Snugride Click Connect 35 even though the product description states that it does. It's also a major pain to try and take apart to return to Amazon given it doesn't work with the car seat referenced above. I would recommend that anybody looking to purchase a stroller like this where your car seat can easily just snap into it go to an actual store and confirm it works before taking the product descriptions word for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Not great for Britax car seats
customer_reviews.text: The product seems well built and is light and easy to use. Unfortunately I have a Britax car seat and the seat is too wide to fit well. It still works with the strap buckled but I would prefer a better fit for my Britax car seat. So, is it universal? I guess technically yes but know what you are getting into with a Britax car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: First one was crooked
customer_reviews.text: The one we received had crooked frame and one of the wheels never touched the ground. I tried working with the manufacturer, but after 2 weeks of sending pictures and other information i was offered to return it for repair, which would have added another week or two, i had to have it simply replaced because customer service is fairly slow. Hopefully the second one is better, will update if it is.
customer_reviews.author: YA

customer_reviews.title: Great convenience item
customer_reviews.text: I like this product because it was inexpensive, lightweight, and easy to carry around and get in and out of my trunk. I don’t really love how the car seat doesn’t click in, it’s just strapped in... and I don’t love the quality of the wheels. Bumps in the pavement sometimes stop the stroller and rocking it back and forth on carpet isn’t smooth... but It’s small and perfect to just pop up and go. I personally hate carrying the baby in her carrier... so I just put the carrier in here to take her into stores quickly and what not. I recommend this product, but not as your only stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You must have this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST stroller. I have 6 kids and 10 strollers and this is the best one and the one I used the most. Trust me-when you have a baby you want something easy and light. You go to store -take it out with one hand- put the car seat on and your off. What more do you want. No adding things or taking things apart. It’s a one deal thing. It rolls nicely on grass as well on the pavement. I had my 1st one for 9 years-Gave it away-then got pregnant again. This was the 1st thing I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: melissa edri

customer_reviews.title: Good but but be cautious it’s not a safe stroller
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to carry I live on the second floor and have no vehicle at the month that alone is difficult to maneuver with a small baby so I bought because the evenflow ser was super heavy this is much better one downfall is it’s not that safe so I have to walk slowly and pay attention to wholes and things like that \Update I attended a mommy and me baby group the strollers were set somewhere to time to get get it another girl grabbed stroller and i grabbed another one I’m feeling like I grabbed the wrong stroller I ordered it oct7 2019 does that stroller have any red
customer_reviews.author: Nila

customer_reviews.title: A must!
customer_reviews.text: After the first time I walked around for 1.5 miles holding the car seat, I realized there’s got to be another way! I was told this frame that converts basically any infant car seat into a stroller is a luxury item, but I disagree- I’d say it is a necessity! Much moreso than plentynof other things I wish I hadn’t gotten... I love taking walks with my little guy with this snap n go stroller! Such a great find!
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to put car seats in (we have Chicco Keyfit ...
customer_reviews.text: We have twins, and sent this stroller to the grandparents' house. Very easy to put car seats in (we have Chicco Keyfit 30). It's pretty light, although still a little bulky (it barely fits in the trunk of my Prius). Still, for the price I'd say it's worth it if you want an easy stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Nice

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: We have the Peg Perego Primo Viaggo 4/35 and were looking for an inexpensive solution for caddying our son in his car seat, and this is it! It’s easy to fold, easy to unfold, and it’s just a sling so you can tilt the infant seat to your preferred angle. The basket underneath is huge and the cup holders are super nice. It’s not the most sturdy stroller, but at its price.... if mine breaks I’ll buy a new one! 4 stars instead of 5 because I’m 5’8” and it seems really short and the little compartment in the parent tray is too small to fit anything but keys.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: The wheels fall off.  Danger!!
customer_reviews.text: Wheel keeps falling apart and it's a really safety issue. I was actually crossing a very narrow bridge when mine came off and the stroller fellforward and to the left. Luckily i wad holding on right. My husband put it back together and I continued using it (while being careful not to take it anywhere like a bridge again and sure enough it's happened 3 more times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expectations exceeded!
customer_reviews.text: I had low expectations for this. My baby is super heavy, and my sturdy stroller is too cumbersome for me as I try to keep my three children together on any given trip. This is a great buy. I didn't want to "waste" the money on another stroller since I already have a traditional stroller, a jogging stroller and a double stroller. This is lightweight and so convenient. My infant is heavy, and his carrier is heavy. I'm no weakling, but together it's too much. I can whip this out of the car, sit the baby in it, grab the other two out of their booster seats and keep moving. So worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Green in VA

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and lightweight. Maneuvers smoothly! Folds up easily! Nice big basket on the bottom to fit diaper bag or purse. Cup holders and a try with lid to hold money or keys. Fit my graco snugride 35 infant car seats fits in my suv trunk easily!! Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for temporary use
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this based on a temporary need after our airline broke our fancy stroller. It fit our nuna Pipa car seat just fine. It can be hard to steer sometimes especially going over bumps and you must push with 2 hands at all times. Also the straps to secure your car seat to the carrier get caught in the hinges when unfolding the carrier so you have to be mindful every time. Overall it’s a decent stroller for every day, light use. It is lightweight to throw in your trunk but definitely cannot suffice as your only stroller option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Wheel broke off after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: AWFUL!!!!! i used this stroller about 4 times. It was soooo flimsy, unreliable. So i bit the bullet and spent Money on a good stroller. I went to go sell this one to someone. As the person was pulling in to buy it, i took the stroller out of my trunk, and the wheel BROKE OFF!!!!! could you imagine if i was out and about with the stroller and the baby was in it??? Do yourself a favor and go buy a quality stroller. This stroller cage is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!! Fit Chicco KeyFit 30
customer_reviews.text: Oh My Goodness!! I had been doing the double stoller thing with my newborn and toddler. I bought this because slinging that giant monstrosity in and out of the van was leading me to avoid using it AT ALL. This, This stroller has made transitioning in the parking lot so much quicker, and therefore much more safe! It is so easy and I am so glad I took a chance with it, I now have my newborn in her carrier in the stroller and carry my 18mth old on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Saves space
customer_reviews.text: Having twins space has become a rare commodity and any instance where we’re able to downsize we definitely do. This stroller is the most compact of strollers for twins, it’s easy to maneuver and light enough where it can be moved in and out of the car. It doesn’t have any type of “snap-in” trait but it’s safe and sturdy enough to have both seats in and utilize the extra storage space. I would definitely recommend this stroller for the first months it has become a lifesaver for me in my journey of being a twin mom.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Gave me some of my freedom back
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have item if you have twins! I thought I would wear my kiddos more, but they were a very healthy birth weight. After a few months, it became uncomfortable to carry them around the city. With this, I'm able to just strap them in their car seats and go. I think it's actually made them like their car seats more. Most importantly, we aren't completely stuck inside. I love this!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great for price and works with my infant Evenflo carseat
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance on this for $30.00 as I didn't want an expensive stroller that could only be used a couple months due to weather here. It works great for my infant carseat, Evenflo even tho it is not listed as compatible, easy to set up. Carsest is held on with safety straps that go through where a seat belt would feed through if not using the car seat base. In my opinion any infant car seat with the seat belt option to buckle without using permanent base should work. It opens and closes very easily and is lightweight and works great until I purchase a better stroller next year.
customer_reviews.author: thumpa2001

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. It fits easily in the trunk of my Honda Civic. It's light and easy to fold/unfold. It takes an extra minute to buckle the car seats in, but once they're buckled, it seems really sturdy. My 3-year-old likes to catch a ride on the side or standing in the basket between the babies, and so far it seems no worse for the wear. My only complaints are that the basket is difficult to access, and my tiny 1-year-old managed to kick the cup holder off while in her seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: It makes life so easy when you're out and about and I'm forever grateful ...
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying how handy this car seat stroller is! It makes life so easy when you're out and about and I'm forever grateful that I haven't had to carry my super heavy carseat everywhere. It's not the nicest in terms of the wheels it has... but for what you pay, I guess you can't expect much. I don't know what I would have done without this stroller, but really wish they had a more luxury model of this. I'd gladly pay more...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safety hazard and very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Within an hour of receiving it and barely pushing it around the park the front right wheel came off into pieces. Just like the other lower rating reviews. I thought "Oh it won't happen to me." .... wellllll it did... While my newborn was in the top part. I was hopeful but this item/manufactured bunch is defective. Safety hazard and disappointing. I called the manufacturer for a spare wheel but the spare parts were created on the same date as the manufactured stroller. They sent it anyway for me to try but I have little hope that it'll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: bbash15

customer_reviews.title: This does not feel completely safe
customer_reviews.text: I have had his for about 2 months now and am using it with the Baby Trend car seat that went with the jogging stroller. Someone stole our stroller out that the car seat attached to so we needed an affordable solution. I do not recommend this stroller. The car seat sits on the frame with a single strap holding it in place. It is not secure, does not click into place as I was anticipating, and does not feel secure to me. The maneuverability is rough, it gets stuck often and does not glide smoothly at all. It is also quite low to the ground. I do not see how this could have passed safety protocols.
customer_reviews.author: E. Garufi

customer_reviews.title: Stroller For universal car seat Frame
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use at the airport to help transport a car seat easily since rental car companies charge so much. I could not believe the price. I was expecting it to cost 3 to 4 times more. This worked perfectly for my needs. It opened easily, I was able to put the car seat on it & safety put my 2 year old grandson to roll around the airport & up to the airplane door. Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne E Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to use with a Graco Elite car seat and it works great. It is super lightweight, the wheels don't get stuck in grass or mud, and the car seat fits really well into it. I like how this folds up at the push of a button. It collapses on its own, you don't even have to shove it down, so it's nice if you only have one hand empty at the moment. I like the cup holders, snap compartment, and basket underneath where the seat goes. Overall I'm really happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Grassshopper021

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, light weight
customer_reviews.text: We've used this for all 3 of our kids. It was a gift for our oldest, handed down to #2, purchased again for #3. My 3rd was an unplanned c section. I highly recommend this stroller if you have a compatible infant seat because it genuinely makes your life 5,000x easier in the first few months after delivery. Even if you aren't the one that delivered baby, save your back from carrying the infant seat all over. The basket has lots of storage space, 2 cup holders, it's nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Bray Pihlman

customer_reviews.title: Started breaking down Midway through week 3
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold for the first 3 weeks then the mechanisms startedto wear down and became very difficult to fold down. Not the most secure since the only thing holding the car seat down is a thin strap of fabric. Maneuverability again for the first three weeks was fine but the wheels started going wonky Midway through week 3. As far as Baby trend products go I'm very disappointed in this one.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Haney

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for travel! This is well worth the money and works great. We took this all over Europe and have used it all around town. It’s very lightweight. The strap works great with our Grace click connect stroller and we had no problems getting it snug. Only con is accessing the storage area is tough with large bags. We would strategically place our backpack in the bottom with pockets as close to the edge as we could for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: the testers

customer_reviews.title: Decent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: This product is helpful for putting the car seat carrier straight out of the car into a stroller that doesn't take up too much room in the car and is not extra bulky for travel. I don't like how this brand has a strap. I had previously owned a Graco brand snap and go that literally snapped to secure itself to the stroller. This product you must use a strap with a buckle and actually place that over the car seat, there are little inserts to hold the strap down on the car seat. It still has some play and doesn't feel as secure as the Graco brand snap and go stroller.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn M.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING. Bought it for my second kid to go with my Britax Be Safe 35 Elite. My Britax stroller broke and I didn't want to buy another one since they're so expensive. This is lighter, easier to maneuver, and easier to get in and out of my car. And the basket underneath is bigger! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: A necessity!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is absolutely amazing and a total life saver for me! We needed to stay on the 2nd floor of a hotel for almost 6 weeks due to flooding in our home and this was such a relief to have as I needed to go up and down to our room with my baby along with laundry, food, etc. The storage compartment was a super nice feature for those things. It is definitely not an off roading stroller but perfect for the mall, stores, sidewalks, parking lots, etc. I finally bought this right before having my 3rd child and wish I would have had this with my first!
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller. It does fit a britax car seat, I didnt even have to unscrew anything. I’m a firm believer in not keeping older babies or children in a stroller unless absolutely necessary so I wasn’t about to invest a huge amount into something I don’t plan on using long term, but let’s face it, lugging an infant car seat sucks. This thing is extremely easy to set up and use and very budget friendly. You really can’t go wrong here.
customer_reviews.author: Orcheez

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Nuna Pipa car seat and needed something small and compact to use when dropping off the little one at daycare. This is easy to use. Small and sturdy. I would highly recommend this product. I use it every day and have no complains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish we had purchased this sooner.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Wish we didn't wait until the twins were 4 months old to purchase this. Super easy to use, car seats sit nicely in the stroller, we have no concerns about stability of the stroller but with that said I would not take this off road. As new parents this stroller has given us the freedom to go shopping/out as a family of 4 rather than just 1 of us making a mad dash to the store. We use Graco SnugRide 30 LX car seats.
customer_reviews.author: Pedalguyeric

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! A must have for those first few months of being a twin mama, ESPECIALLY when you have a toddler in tow. This made getting in and out of doctor's appointments, grocery stores, and parks REALLY easy. We have two Chicco Keyfit carseats and they sit inside perfectly. I HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: LIKE NO OTHER STROLLER, SIMPLY THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought my newborn's car seat and couldn't find the right stroller. Every stroller individually sold was not adapted for a car seat, and the ones who were, they came as a bundle with a car seat already. It was a struggle to find the perfect stroller that fit my necessities! I came across this one and OMG, it is PERFECT! It is very easy to maneuver, light weight, and extremely compact. Loved it! I would give it 10 out of 10 stars if I could!⭐
customer_reviews.author: It'sBlackLuna

customer_reviews.title: Universal snap and go stroller for car seats
customer_reviews.text: Such a help! And so easy to travel with, by both car and plane. Worked well with my car seat even though it was an older car seat. My biggest complaint is that the description said it was to come with a tray for cup/keys/etc., but mine wasn’t in the box. When I tried to contact the company I never heard back from them. Otherwise it’s a great stroller and very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Misleading name
customer_reviews.text: The name is misleading. I thought snap and go meant the car seat would snap onto the stroller like it does on the car seat base. What it actually means is you wrap a strap around the car seat and it's a snap buckle. The strap therefore is over the top of your child which seems like it will be in the way when they are kicking their feet and it's not easy to just slip them in and out. It feels like a less secure way to connect the car seat. It feels pretty flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I have a babytrend carseat & decided to purchase this for my baby girly. We used it 2x for a walk in the park & the doctors office. It's very easy to handle & push. Happy I found it! It's so convenient.
customer_reviews.author: asia D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Convenient, Light-weight, MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had known this existed sooner... Carrying my son in his carrier kept getting harder and harder the older he got. I decided to buy one of these when I saw other moms with the same stroller. It’s so much easier than the jogging stroller we had previously purchased. Don’t get me wrong, we love our jogging stroller for walks and whatnot. However, this stroller is super convenient for going to and from the car, running small errands like doctors appointments, etc. In addition, it’s super easy to fold and fits right in the backseat. Plus, it’s light weight so I can handle it on my own without help from my husband. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must for twin moms
customer_reviews.text: I knew when I found out I was having twins I wanted something light weight and easy to get in and out of places as quick and easy as possible. I had something similar when my son was an infant so I was excited to find this one. My car seat was not on the list of car seats that worked with this stroller but I was willing to risk it to see if it would work and it did! I have Peg Perego car seats. This is a must for any new twin mom! It’s easy to fold up. Easy to get in and out of places. Maneuvers really well. Has a large storage basket.
customer_reviews.author: Madi Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I bought this instead of the more expensive Chicco brand. My Chicco Fit2 carseat fits perfectly. This is so easy to put together and fold up. It's also very light, making it easy to get in and out of the car. The only con I have experienced is that I can't get the diaper bag in and out of the basket underneath when the car seat is on. Other than that, it has been perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany G.

customer_reviews.title: It’s functional but not really convenient
customer_reviews.text: It’s functional but it’s not very sturdy I don’t like to put the car seat in it because it’s only held up with straps there’s no way to secure it otherwise. It also doesn’t do very well and you had on sidewalks at the brewery and it’s not very easy to fold up plus it doesn’t stand on its own so it’s constantly falling over when I’m trying to store it. Ultimately I want to return it but I’ve used it twice it just isn’t worth it when I could spend another $40 and have something that functions much better
customer_reviews.author: Festr06

customer_reviews.title: So easy !
customer_reviews.text: Love it! My husband and I were using our travel system stroller. But then we decided to take a vacation to Miami. And the flight wouldn’t allow us to gate check a stroller more than 20 lbs. the travel system stroller is also bulky and just a hassle especially when you have to attach the car seat to it. I’m sure by itself it’s much easier to bring along. But our son was still in a car seat so we wanted something more compact, and light weight. Glad we found this! It’s perfect. So easy to use. So light. Easy to fold. Even coming back from our trip, we continue to use it regularly. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great! So light weight!
customer_reviews.text: I have a baby trend car seat, this fits perfectly. I love how lightweight this is. It's easy to fold and unfold. Holds the car seat securely. The rear brakes are easy to lock and unlock. This is so lightweight I can carry it folded closed in one hand and my baby in her car seat in the other and walk up and down the stairs. This is definitely an essential!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Seagle-Amaya

customer_reviews.title: ehhh, you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: new mom here, wasn't aware of travel systems, if i had known about them i would've gotten one. we were gifted our car seat and this was the only stroller that was compatible. well, its cheap, you can feel that right away. the maneuverability of it is not very good. its okay to go to a store, but not anywhere else. it is super easy to unfold and strap the car seat in, i did like that!
customer_reviews.author: Yazmin Longoria

customer_reviews.title: Finally something lightweight!
customer_reviews.text: I use this instead of my super expensive stroller. This is so much lighter and pops up so easily that I actually like it better for my baby. I don't have an SUV so it was important for me to find something that fits in my car's trunk and this fits and still leaves room. I know I won't be able to use it forever so i'm getting as much use out of it now that I can!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and lightweight. Maneuvers smoothly! Folds up easily! Nice big basket on the bottom to fit diaper bag or purse. Cup holders and a try with lid to hold money or keys. Fit my graco snugride 35 infant car seat. Would fit in any trunk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for air travel
customer_reviews.text: We have used this multiple times for air travel and it is great so you have a stroller and can also bring the car seat without having to check it as baggage. We leave it planeside and pick it up on our way off, pop the car seat on, and go. The storage compartment underneath isn’t huge but I can hold our medium sized diaper bag and a few jackets or other small items.
customer_reviews.author: Anon44

customer_reviews.title: It's easily accessible and opened
customer_reviews.text: I have Baby Trend car seats but I believe this fits many other car seats as well. This has been exceptionally helpful when taking the twins anywhere I have to get them out of the car. I've had to take it Furniture shopping, grocery shopping, and many other places. It's easily accessible and opened. I would recommend this to anyone who is having twins as it will make your life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Tasha L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for indoor use only
customer_reviews.text: We took a chance on this item because the price was affordable. At first it was wonderful. We used it in the mall and the supermarket. But then we used it around the neighborhood. After a few outdoor excursions the wheels looked like they were 10 years old. Now it pushes like a grocery cart with a twisted wheel. It’s loud and very bumpy. If you buy this I recommend using it only on very smooth indoor surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: monkev

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t have a stroller before our twins were born and after the first outing, we were looking for one. I was a little nervous because the seats don’t click into this stroller but it has been great. It accommodates both our car seats and they are different brands (Chico Keyfit 30 and Recaro). It is a little bulky but for a double stroller I can’t complain too much. The price point is great compared to other double strollers. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Alida

customer_reviews.title: Fits evenflo embrace car seats!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Very easy to open and close. Folds down well. Very easy to put together. Fits both of my evenflo embrace car seats well. The only reason I give 4 stars is because the car seats don't snap in per se; rather there is a belt that goes over the car seat and snaps together. So, the car seats can be a little wiggly if bumped, but is still safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rose G

customer_reviews.title: Saved Money, Saves precious trunk space, great alternative to buying pricey travel systems
customer_reviews.text: I neglected to purchase the entire evenflo pivot travel system (I really didn't want to spend $300+ on something that would be used for less than 6months) and this carseat caddy/stroller was the only universal one that my seat fit into and securely! Affordable, easy to assemble, light weight, and sturdy. I use it almost daily. And it's also compatible with a universal boogy board for my older child to stand on for our every day outings
customer_reviews.author: christopher p.

customer_reviews.title: Go-To Stroller
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest, I was initially skeptical of this stroller but saw it had good reviews so we went ahead and got it. Turns out it’s perfect. We have the Chicco KeyFit30s and they fit perfect in the frame. For whatever reason, my son was terrified of his car seat and using this to take him on walks has completely calmed him down, and he no longer panics when being placed in his car seat. Great stroller for twins!
customer_reviews.author: Cate F.

customer_reviews.title: The car seat does not snap into the stroller make sure you keep your kids safe
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like that the car seat does not snap and it’s a strap that you have to click together I don’t feel like it safe for infant to be and you have to be very careful with your child in the stroller but is very convenient if you have to go somewhere that’s not too too far if the car seat was able to snap I will give them a five star but it doesn’t the stroller supposed to be a snap and go snap and go But the only thing that snaps is the wheels
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Not Really Universal, Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It does not work with our infant carrier. We loved how lightweight it was and how easy it is to use but we can’t put our little guy in it, cause his carrier slides off the top, so we wasted $30. Really wanted to like it. I would say if you don’t have a babytrend carseat, don’t purchase the stroller. Despite what the Q&A section says. It said our carrier would fit, but it doesn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Bernard

customer_reviews.title: Great for short, daily tasks.
customer_reviews.text: Our Britax car seat didn't have a cheap option for a stroller. We have a BOB running stroller but it's a bit heavy for every day use. We got this for daily use and it's amazing. Granted it doesn't turn or roll as well as the BOB but that's not a fair comparison. The weight and folding is worth it and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg on a stroller I knew we would hardly use. Bought this and we have used it so much just because of how easy it is! It's so light and fits in my car perfect. Better than spending 100's on a stroller you can only use for so long. I would 100% buy this again and again. My Britax B-Safe car seat fits perfect in this.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Oetken

customer_reviews.title: Great price point!
customer_reviews.text: I would have loved to buy the brand that went with my car seat to “click” it in but it was more then twice the amount! Yes you do have to buckle the seat in but it’s still secure. This is easy to set up & very lightweight. I would definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a cheap light weight stroller to carry their car seat in. So convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B

customer_reviews.title: Car seat is a bit loose but it will work
customer_reviews.text: My in-laws lost the original Baby Trend stroller base we had. This one is more of a cradle for the car seat to rest in so the strap to hold the seat in place is going to be super important. The Baby Trend car seat that we have used to 'click' into the stroller we had. This one doesn't have the click option.
customer_reviews.author: happyape

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, strap broke in two places with regular use
customer_reviews.text: Strap broke in two places. Very unsafe and poor quality. I recommend getting the one for your specific car seat so it snaps in and you aren’t relying on just a strap
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for double carseat stroller
customer_reviews.text: This was a major life saver! It worked great for our baby trend and chicco keyfit carseats. This made our shopping trips a breeze and made it easier for me to take the twins to dr appointments alone. We had to get a new stroller and feel like I was spoiled with this one. It's a little long but I would 10 out of 10 use it again in a heart beat
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: I've had bulky strollers and this isn't. I love that it's easy to fold and fits into my car. I also love that the car seat I have Graco snug ride snuglock 35 LX infant carseat fits well. This stroller. Does not click, so do not get upset after you order and realize a buckle secures the carseat. The carseat doesn't wobble once it is is buckled.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Hello FREEDOM!
customer_reviews.text: New mom here - who had no idea these existed until I saw a lady in the parking lot get hers out. I almost chased her down asking her what it was called. I was lugging around my giant, heavy jogger stroller and with all my back pain issues began wondering why any mom would leave the house with the baby it was THAT inconvenient. This gave me my freedom back to easily run multiple errands at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: JUST. DO .IT
customer_reviews.text: As a mom of four, I really WISH I had bought this product BEFORE the last baby! I can not express how helpful this little thing is with grocery shopping or any indoor trips. I do not recommend going hiking with it, the wheels are too small, BUT anything indoors and this product is a LIFE SAVER! ESPECIALLY when the baby falls asleep in the car and all you have to do is put that baby carrier in this and go. No more waking up baby to put them in a stroller. PSH...this is the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Hookway

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Better than the twin chicco stroller. Storage can be utilized with carriers in place. Not overly bulky. Easy to maneuver. Only downside is it feels strange not having the carriers snap/lock into place. Each Carrier is held by a single strap. If that bothers you dont buy. I don't plan on off roading with the twins so hopefully will all go swimmingly the duration of use.
customer_reviews.author: Mashelly27

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t realize we needed a stroller until we put our girl in the one we had. She was way too small for the ones we had, and any other stroller for infants would have been WAAAAY too expensive. This one works great! I can pull the car seat out of here, and fold it down with one hand. It’s not heavy, easy to put together, and has lasted us so far (my girl is 4 months now). I would recommend this to everyone. We have an evenflo car seat.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Hildebrandt

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Product defect We bought for our one month old grandson He like to fell out he could’ve been really got hurt he is on #6stroller yes 6 his original stroller we are still looking for the bracket so that he can use his Infant seat we decide to buy this product for the time being we are still trying to find the bar for his big stroller so that we could use his infant seat we decide to buy just fell apart and only thing we had to do was just put the wheels on Amazon re-ordered it for use I have nightmares for the last couple weeks instead purchased snugrider 3 elite Wonderful stroller
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Miller

customer_reviews.title: Hard to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is definitely adorable and worked with my Britax bsafe car seat. My only complaint, which definitely affects the entire purchase is that it is very hard to maneuver. The front wheels don't glide smoothly at all and it makes turning very difficult. I wouldn't but this stroller again.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: We love this great portable double stroller for twins.
customer_reviews.text: Great double stroller for twins, it folds up nice and easy, takes up very little space in my SUV. One of the reasons we bought it was because we read reviews of how easy it was and light weight compared to other double strollers. We have the babybtrend cars seats that just go on the frame and you can fasten the sests with straps that go over the seats. It’s manuvable, not bulky. Highly recommend it to anyone expecting twins:)
customer_reviews.author: Catwoman

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: This Thing Is A Life Saver. I Have Not Yet Put The Twins In It, But I Put It Together and Rigged It to Lock My Car seats In Place. I Bought The Plastic Covering Due To COVID To Protect My Babies Which Has Ventilation, and The Fans To Cool Them Off Inside.. All From Amazon Bit The Stroller Is Light weight and Easy To Fold Up. waaaaay BETTER Then The 200$ Stroller Thats Heavy And Hard To Assemble That I Barely Use, this Was A Great Buy. When I Put The Twins In It I’ll Give An Update ...
customer_reviews.author: Timyah

customer_reviews.title: Was hesitant but a good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something for my maxi Cosi 30 that didn't require the use of the adapters (the bane of my existence.) Was hesitant to purchase this at first as the car seat doesn't lock into place, however, I'm very glad I did. Unless you are off-roading with this stroller, the "bucket" design works just fine. It is exactly what I needed at a fraction of the price of other strollers. You just set the seat in and off you go. One star off for the somewhat inaccessible storage underneath. Still definitely worth buying - and more so than the newer snap-n-go version that costs $100.
customer_reviews.author: Emily G.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and simple
customer_reviews.text: We have an older Eddie Bauer car seat that we use with this stroller. It’s a little lose however, I just use the strap where the car seatbelt would go and keeps the car seat in place. I like the large basket on bottom and the two cup holders. The best is that it’s nice and lightweight which is handy since the car seat with baby is so heavy. I’m not tall or very strong so I love the “skeleton strollers”. This is the second one I’ve bought and prefer it over the regular stroller
customer_reviews.author: April in paradise

customer_reviews.title: Compact and quick, bus rider
customer_reviews.text: This is my second snap and go. Said I would buy again and here I have brought again. Needed it for compact again and it works fine. Big basket for everything while at the mall. No big stroller trying to get in tight stores. Easy to fold also. Very light weight on the bus, I do not drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Jeannine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fold and unfold
customer_reviews.text: Could have out the straps that go over car seat in another location. They always get trapped inside and is a pain to get out. You buckle this and thread the straps thru where the seatbelt would go on the car seat, warning lables are right in the middle of same place so the straps constantly get stuck and twisted. Easy to fold and unfold, would be cool it it came in other colors too.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: My favorite stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Great for my twins and I'm so glad it's compatible with their Graco click connect 30 car seats! Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Naj

customer_reviews.title: Storage + Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my sister when she had her baby. It folds easily with the push of 2 buttons, and is about 10lbs approximately all together. We used it to walk my nephew, I'm grocery stores and parks. In the photo is me. I'm 5'7" so you can gauge how tall the carrier is. It does have room for a smartphone but it didn't fit mine with the case. I have a Note 9 with an Otterbox. Without the case it would fit though. My sister also kept 2 big diaper bags below when using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: I pick up my 6 month old grandson from daycare and I need to carry him out to the car. This was very difficult because of the heaviness of the child in the carseat. Now, I just quickly get this stroller out of my car, grab the baby, and comfortably wheel him out.
customer_reviews.author: DW

product_meta.title: Baby Trend Universal Double Snap-N-Go Stroller Frame
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Universal Double Snap N GoThe new Baby Trend Universal Double Snap-N-Go accepts 2 infant car seats and with a larger frame that acts like a cradle for a better fit for car seats. Allows adult to place 2 infant car seats onto carriage frame without removing your children from the car seat arranged in stadium seating. A 2-cup holder parent tray with covered storage compartment makes this a lightweight and easy to transport choice for parents on the go. This stroller has a convenient one hand fold, and comes with a large drop down storage basket. For stability, this stroller features rear wheels with brakes.

BRAND STORY
By
feature_bullets: Larger cradle frame for better fit for all car seats
2 cup holder parent tray with covered storage compartment

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,816 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
